page.title: 19BUDBROOKE FARM
page.content: 360 acres rented from Lord Dormer by the Shelswell family(Dad,Mum,Granny, Henry(8),myself-William(9)). Livestock:85 Frisian milking cows(5000 litres milk per cow per year sold to Milk Marketing Board),41 heifers of different ages kept for replacements, sheep in winter on cattle grazing ground.Bull calves are sold at 3 weeks at Stratford or Banbury Stockyards.1 sow with 12 piglets used for home consumption.Crops:120 acres grass,200 acres corn,wheat & barley,40 acres rape.Farm run by Daddy and 2 employed men.Have 6 tractors and a combine. Silage is made with neighbour to feed cows in Winter when cows are kept in cubicles.Henry and I help with the milking and feeding young stock.We also like to help Daddy in workshop We have 3 dogs,2 cats,2 horses and Henry and I have a ferret each.
